modules.title: Code is Debt - why No Code and AI is key moving forward
points: Why custom code should be your last resort
Understanding the n8n ecosystem
Mapping business processes to automation workflows
ROI analysis: Custom code vs automation tools
Success stories from n8n implementations
Hands-On Project: Build an API wrapper that provides the business co-code api and business supporting solution

modules.title: Solution Architecture with n8n
points: n8n architecture fundamentals
Workflow-driven solution design
Integration patterns with n8n
When to use n8n vs other tools
Hands-On Project: Use scraping to gather data from an existing site and modernize it with RAG, Hybrid Search, APIs driven by N8N and a great UI built in Cursor AI. Categorize the data

modules.title: Advanced n8n Development and AI Agents
points: Here we dig deep into the AI Agent
We look at Tools and the AI Agent and how it's a game changer
Code Less with the Tools Pattern
External Workflows
Hands-On Project: Build complex AI Agent Tool Drive API to manage user interactions around meal planning, demonstrating the power of AI Agents and Tools

modules.title: Module 4 - Deep dive into AI Agents, Tools and N8N as an Agentic Framework
points: What is Agentic and how can we use it
n8n as an Agentic Framework
Hands-On Project: Build an Agentic System that will learn from its past success and feedback, integrating AI Tools from previous modules and External Workflows

modules.title: Putting it all together once again Ai, Automations, And Integrations
points: Introducing Voice Ai
Reacting to Events
Smart Databases and Events
Hands-On Project: Build a system using RAG and Natural Voice to take in coming voice calls and respond to you as you speak with the LLM. Use AI Agents to help understand and route calls when busy

modules.title: Production Deployments and Setup
points: How to host these applications in confidence
Scaling with Redis and Workers
N8N as Serverless Drop in Replacement
Deployments Staging to Production
Hands-On Project: Deploy applications from Staging to Production with multiple workers and Redis as a Queue, demonstrating enterprise-scale deployment patterns
